title: Proverb of the day: He who tied me up is making a rope for you اللي قيدني بيفتلك - Folk Arts - Folk
text:
اللي قيدني بيفتلك
Elli Qayyedni be yeftellak
Translation: He who tied me up is making a rope for you.
Meaning: Don’t gloat over my misfortune, for you’re going to be next. This proverb, now extinct, is perhaps related to times of slavery, forcible conscription, or forced labour, when victims were rounded up and tied, then marched out of their villages into an unknown future. Corvee, or forced labour, was abolished in Egypt in the mid nineteenth century. Slavery disappeared shortly afterwards.
Source: Egyptian Proverbs, (Al-Ahram Center for Translation and Publishing, 1986) by Ahmed Taymour Pasha
Translated by: Nabil Shawkat
